intro: Ruellia petiolaris, commonly known as the narrow-leaf ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features opposite, narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are blue to purple in color, arranged in clusters at the tips of the stems. Ruellia petiolaris is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
